required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Effect of Laser Acupuncture on Improving Cancer-related Fatigue
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Effect of Laser Acupuncture on Improving Cancer-related Fatigue

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the clinical effect of laser acupuncture on improving cancer-related fatigue

detailed_description.textblock: This study adopted a randomized controlled design, 2-arm trial cross-over study. All eligible patients included in the study agreed to participated and signed the informed consent from and the study procedures were approved by the ethical committee of Taichung Tzu Chi general hospital (REC110-09). Patients were recruited from the hematology oncology department of Taichung Tzu Chi general hospital. After random assignment to 2 groups, patients in the RS and SR groups will receive real and shame laser acupuncture. Before laser acupuncture, one week later, we will evaluate the patient-reported cancer-related fatigue index and other co-morbid symptoms.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized controlled, double blind, cross-over study.
study_design_info.masking_description: After random assignment to 2 groups, patients in the RS and SR groups will receive real and shame laser acupuncture (single blinding), six consecutive times every day.

primary_outcome.description: ICD-10 Fatigue Criteria Brief Fatigue inventory-Taiwan Form

secondary_outcome.description: Taiwanese Version of the M.D. Anderson symptom Inventory (MDASI-T)

arm_group.description: Patients in the Real laser acupuncture group will receive real laser pen irradiation.
Patients in the Shame laser acupuncture group will receive shame laser pen irradiation.

intervention.description: This study will use German-made low-level laser pen (Al-Ga-As diode laser, 810nm, NIR, Physiolaser Olympic Basic, RJ laser). The parameters are power of 100mW, frequency of Bahr, apply on acupoint. Well will irradiate each point for 2 J. Each patient will receive this treatment six times for one week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults between 18 to 85 years old
- Patients who signed the informed consent form
- Patients who have been given a diagnosis of cancer
- Able to communicate verbally and completely fill the questionnaires
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have given a diagnosis of cognitive impairment are unable to completely the questionnaires
